attributes.action: Introduce Card Only payments in shops and Restaurants  for Coronvirus outbreak
attributes.additional_details: To reduce the risk of coronavirus three cross-contamination with cash
attributes.background: Stop all cash transactions And only use card To reduce the risk of contracting coronavirus

rejection.details:
It is up to individual retailers and restaurants to decide what forms of payment to accept, not the Government or Parliament.

The Government's guidance to some sectors already recommends that they avoid handling cash and use mobile or contactless card payments.

You could ask the Government to update its advice to recommend to all businesses and consumers that they should avoid handling cash and use mobile or contactless card payments.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
